page.title: 17RANBY PRISON
page.content: IN 1971 AN ARMY CAMP OF THE ROYAL TANK CORPS WAS TAKEN OVER AND OPENED UP AS ONE OF HER MAJESTIES PRISONS - RANBY. IT IS A CATAGORY "C" PRISON TAKING IN OFFENDERS WHO HAVE BEEN GIVEN SENTENCES OF UP TO 18 MONTHS. THEY ARE INMATES FROM LOCAL PRISONS WITHIN THE AREA AND ARE PLACED ON A INDUSTRIAL AND EDUCATIONAL TIMETABL THEY ARE IN FACT TRANSFERRED HERE FROM JAILS IN LINCOLN,LEEDS,BEDFORD,BIRMINGHAM AND LEICESTER. THERE ARE 426 PRISONERS AND ARE LOOKED AFTER BY SOME 55 WARDERS. LOCAL MAGISTRAITES SIT ON THE BOARD OF VISITORS TO SEE THAT FAIR PLAY IS BEING GIVEN. A LOCAL REVIEW COMMITTEE LOOKS INTO THE POSSIBILITY OF PAROLE. THERE ARE OUTSIDE WORKING PARTIES BUT THE GENERALLY SEE TO PRISON AMENITIES. AT THE MOMENT NEW PREMISES ARE REPLACING THE OLD ARMY BILLETS.
